page.title: 08Felixstowe Dock
page.content: Felixstowe Port started in 1875. It was started by the Felixstowe Railway and Pier Act.Its promoter was Colonel Toml- ine.A railway line 13 miles long was c- onstructed.This transport line went fr- om Ipswich to Felixstowe.On 1st May 1877 was the first passenger train and this was followed a month later by the freight trains.In 1886 the dock was opened for trade and the first commer- cial vessel entered. The dock at this time had a tidal basin that was 6 acres in area with a 147ft.wide entrance from Harwich harbour. A maltings was erected on the south side of the dock basin for brewing barley. During W.W.I Felixstowe became a base for destroyers & minesweepers, and in 1916 additional railway sidings were installed for the Royal Navy to use. In 1951 Mr. H. Gordon- Parker, who was a Norfolk grainmerchant bought it.
